reviews:
Still can't disable free call! No option to disable free call. We should not have to install another app for messages.  If anything, free call should be it's own app so we have the option to install it or not.   Full Review

When i try to close or switch conversations, i woll accidently call the person i currently have a conversation  open with. For the most part besides this, i find this app very useful. It takes up a lot of space and it requires too many permissions, but it gets the job done.   Full Review

 Stupid. Badly in need of UI upgrade and material design. I'm about to uninstall this, if you don't do a serious update to improve it. Dumb app, 2 apps for 1 website. Worked just fine in the Facebook app itself. At least put some effort into it, still looks like basic ios crap. Time to get some better android programmers, app is a battery and resource hog, demands too many permissions. Plus, needs a better UI, material design, asap. Every app I use has been updated to material design for over a year, big names (like Twitter) to small independent developers. EXCEPT FOR FACEBOOK, MESSENGER & INSTAGRAM. Where is the logout option?   Full Review

 Does anyone actually use calling? Everyone I know never uses the call features. The button placement is annoying and leads to accidental calls. As well as this, there's no way prevent calls from popping up. Give us a button on whether we want to enable being called or something. Also, finally, with group calling if a chat is muted, you still get the notification. Moreover, if a person is spam calling, kicking them from group doesn't seem to have much effect, if they're in the call and get removed it still has them calling. Poorly executed.   Full Review

Photos refuse to save, and it's not a space problem I checked, and sometimes on the process of saving a photo (if I'm lucky)  kik will crash!  kik is also laggy and has been no matter how much I restart my Samsung Tab. I easily could've re-downloaded the app but sadly kik seriously needs to add an option to be able to be logged on the same account on multiple devices or for the conversations not to be deleted when logged off. Another thing kik needs to bring back: hashtags!  Please! This is what led me to find awesome people,  really it was fun to talk to New people... Hash tags for groups were one of the best parts about Kik, and it should be brought back to please the customers and users on Kik. Problem 2: Lots of "harassment" from random people... You can be texted by really anyone else who comes across your username. Kik Codes only ½ prevents this.   Full Review

One is when data signal is low it takes forever for it to swap over from data to cell signal calling on some phones switching data off before dialing makes the app just hang at dialing (moto e and volt issue, moto g would switch almost immediately) also since the update before current even though it still dials it gives the error that the number dialed is invalid until the app is forced closed. However, what distinguishes Line from the rest is its ability to log in using Facebook, it's convenient photo album and note capabilities, it's pleasing aesthetics and finally... Brown and Cony! ") <---- this happens to every pic that is sent to me and its getting annoying   Full Review

 Picture blocked or changed? Had problem with pictures sent from friends via chat. Sometimes blocked because "not sent from line server". Only use 1 network from mobile provider , + wifi connection. Never seen this before, Please fix it   Full Review

If you want to keep the feature, please give us the customer the good article with good information/inspiring articles. Despite most of articles are about trashy celebrity who didn't made anything to this country, we need more good articles.   Full Review   
 Very bad - account only for 1 device. Can't be used on 2nd one. Only exception is a PC. Cannot handle screen rotation on Samsung Tab S with Android Lollipop + I often cannot hang up after a free call. There is no button to see that I can press. This window is often gone. Always have to ask the other side to hang up then. I was also not able to add a user by searching for his user-id. Nothing at all is shown there. And the worst of all l have a tablet and a phone and according to Line you can't use the same account on both devices. So what now?! Useless app. Can only use 1 device. What a bad joke and unrealistic Line world. In addition the PC app always forgets the login data. VERY Annoying. Now I need it to confirm on my tablet if I logon at my PC. What a scrap if you travel and use Internet shops. Now letter sealing suddenly. Can't read messages again on the PC... What a scrap.   Full Review   
 Stickers problem Some of the stickers are not showing in sticker display suggestion. I have downloaded all the stickers that are necessary but the problem still remain. It's very inconvenience   Full Review   
 Motorola Droid Turbo At last! After all my searching and frustration I finally found what I needed. A few months ago I moved to an area bereft of cell phone service even though I am with one of the biggest carriers. We signed up with a cable provider that also provided WiFi. We could assess the internet (messaging) but not make calls. Line lets me use my own telephone number and call wherever I want for a small fee. It's simple to use and has never dropped a call. Just terrific! Thanks!   Full Review   
  Got problem after the last update. Each time I want to send something from the chat screen (pictures, videos, etc), a popup is shown telling that line has stopped working. Already restart the phone and the app, I can't try to uninstall it because it got some important chats. Pls fix it :( thanks   Full Review   
 Last update is a disaster Like many of you I use line for online games. The last update does not just display an onscreen simple notification and tap to disappear. Now it will block your view much longer than normal. In the thick of battle it's a disaster, just in typing this I've been held up 10 times. Fix it please. Loss of 4 stars.   Full Review

I followed every prompt when changing device and opened 2 step verification on original device but it still says ,"an error has occurred please try again later" or, "invalid phone number" when I clearly typed in my phone number....this app used to be easy to use But now it's just plain painful. As great an app as it is it seems to have poor data dumping functions, which ends up taking a very large part of storage capacity. Moreover, upon manually deleting data the app requires you to sign in and claim that by signing in on your "new phone" you must delete all conversations backed up on the server.   Full Review

 S5;50mbps;Full Charge From what I've experienced, theres a small glitch where if you scroll down enough, the app resets you to the top or just up. Also, the reason I installed the app in the first place, was to see how many followers one has by searching them. I've seen it happen before, but now its gone? And if it is, why? Is there a good reason to remove it? Otherwise clean, +4.5   Full Review

But at 3G or slower connections that refresh takes 20 to 30 seconds, or more. Meanwhile I'm stuck looking at a blank grey screen. The web page works faster than the app does. Bad app developer, no cookie.   Full Review

The other major problem is B) Images either take way too long to load or never load at all :( please fix this! Thank you!   Full Review

title: All Email Providers

reviews:
Email done right This is an email client done right. Gmail has issues with my exchange account. For some reason, when i reply using gmail on my exchange account, my reply gets cut. Mailwise does not have that issue.   Full Review   
 Emails out of sync My gmail often goes out of sync and failed to connect to server. Could not send emails which stucks in outbox. I missed important emails, the same works fine with gmail app.   Full Review   
  Great app. I like the way I can combine my inboxes. The conversation view is also great. Better than the Gmail app that keeps crashing.  Easier to configure than the Microsoft Outlook app.  Would like to see integrated calendar.   Full Review   
  I wanted to love Mailwise. I really did. It's got a clean, easy-to-use interface, and is nicely responsive. But there's a fundamental flaw.  Unlike any other mail app I've used (stock, K-9, BlueMail, others) Mailwise cannot manage to sync my Sent and Trash folders with my IMAP folders or map them from the app, so I can't read my Sent & Trash from other devices. This may be a problem specific to my setup with Bluehost mail servers and your mileage may vary, but for me, it's a fatal flaw.  I tried for over a month to get this sorted out with the developer, but they've been pretty sporadic in responding and have not provided a solution. If I could get this issue taken care of, I'd probably jump to 5 stars...   Full Review   
 Unfortunately as an IT System Admin I must rank 1 star Allowing users to bypass exchange rule enforcement is an extremely large security risk. While the app itself is great, I have been forced to block it in our environment as the ability to do so breaks the contract signed by employees when they start. Many of them do not understand this and view it as protection against a remote wipe by our company (only used in terminations during which the ex employee refuses to remove the account with a staff member present). Government information is strictly safeguarded.   Full Review   
 STILL no unread count on icon on S5 Edit: New update and still the same thing.  Mailwise addressed my other issues and they appear to have been resolved.  However, I still am getting no unread count on the app icon on my S5 even though the box is checked.  Works fine on my S4 mini though.   Full Review

reviews:
its nice but why my e mail disappear from the inbox. when i open my in box if there is new mail its comes but again when i close and open again inbox is empty plz give me the solution to gix this issue.   Full Review

"Persistent Incoming Server Network Errors" is what I am getting with my Pop3 email account and this started after the most recent update - fix this and I will be back to loving this app and it will get 5 stars - but at this point, this purchased app is basically useless!!! :/     EDIT: not sure what happened but all is working correctly now!!! Awesome App!!!!!! :) SECOND EDIT: the problem is NOT fixed - and have not heard from the Developer - boo!!!   Full Review   
 It's pretty good And keeps getting better. Shame that it doesn't have smart folders like in gmail. 5.4.16 Finally I managed to update. Update wasn't working for a while.   Full Review   
 CAN'T FORWARD/REPLY OR SEARCH (BASIC EMAIL FUNCTIONS) DESPITE BEING ONE OF THE BEST EMAIL CLIENTS Messages usually load fine for viewing but when replying to or forwarding a message, it will get stuck trying to load the message. If you let it sit, it will never load but sometimes if you cancel it and keep retrying, it will eventually load. This happens on my IMAP account even when I have a good, active data connection. Plus Search BLOWS!! ..it just simply does not work. I've had these problems ever since I first found & started using Aquamail (YEARS AGO!). It's time for a new email client.   Full Review   
 5 BIG stars! AquaMail raised the bar so high to really set itself apart from all other email apps. I would give it 10 stars if I could. It is beyond customizable, supports multiple accounts, aliases, and so much more. Great customer support, extensive website with instructions and answers. Well worth the one-time pro purchase. Phenomenal job dev!! Thank you!!   Full Review   
 To the point! Not too fancy, it skips some bells and whistles for sheer simplicity and efficiency. It helps organize all my email accounts into one straight forward app!   Full Review   
 Best app available for email on Android platform Excellent application ;very well advanced over stock native Gmail app. A world away; packed with customizations and features - well worth upgrading (highly recommended) a great gift to yourself!Thanks to dev. Good work- I'm impressed! The application makes email fun! Get the pro, guaranteed you'll be happy - 1,000,000+ people can't be wrong even w/o upgrade.   Full Review   
  I've tried most of the Android email clients. The default mail app is crap (no mass delete? What a joke). Stuck with K-9 for a few months but gave up waiting for UI improvements and I could never get notification badges to work properly (S6 Edge). Outlook isn't bad, but MS has alienated me recently with "you need a Microsoft account" for everything under the sun. No thanks.  Installed Aqua and then purchased the second day. I have no issues with dev's getting compensated for their work.If you cant afford $6.00 then use a free one.  Just a pet peeve here...Why oh WHY do people complain about paying for an app? Is someone holding a gun to your head and FORCING you to purchase it? Just move on man, nobody cares why you don't want to pay for it.  Aqua is very feature rich and has a pleasant UI which does not look dated and stuck in the 90's. Pretty much everything has customization.   I also REALLY like the font options, re: sizing, bold, underlining and so forth. Very similar to a Word toolbar, and it works even for setting a sig. You can also insert and re-size images very easily.  So all in all, a very solid email client.   Full Review   
 Great features, fantastic support Recent support from dev is best I've ever experienced on Android. Incredible number of settings & features available in a somewhat complex, but well organized structure. If you're having problems with a specific function, there's probably a setting for that. The ui is, imho, elegantly implemented.  Dev is actively developing additional features, and as hinted, fixes stuff asap. Well worth Pro$. .. Please ditch the stupid FAB (floating action button).   Full Review   
 I would have liked it but. .. This app would be awesome except for one thing. ..It will only allow you to add two accounts, any more and you have to pay to unlock it. Bugger that, there are plenty of email apps out there that are just as good and let you use more than two accounts for FREE. I just can't bring myself to pay for an email app, sorry dev. Nice effort but I wish I had have known the limitations before I installed and set it up. Now uninstalling.   Full Review

  I was happy, then I realized the promo signature... :( to prominent for a "free version" app. the app though is fast, well designed and pretty clever. I preferred it over cloudmail, k9mail, gmail, bluemail amm. BUT I  also think 7 dollars is really expensive to remove the annoying promo signature.  Why you don't use in app ads?  cheers anyway.   Full Review   
 One of the best. It's been over a year since I first tried this app so I thought about giving it another shot and it STILL can't see my custom folders in yahoo. Is that so hard to accomplish?! Edit: bug solved, now almost perfect app.   Full Review   
  Now that AquaMail has threaded conversations, I'll never look at another email app again. I've tried at least 8 email apps on Android, and AquaMail has the following advantages (off the top of my head): - Fantastic vertical split-screen handling - Tons of customization - Ability to NOT stay on in the background listening for push (if, like me, you'd rather only check mail while the app is running) - Really clear and simple handling of multiple accounts (fewer steps to switch between accounts than other apps) - Great compose UI - Doesn't sync secondary folders unless you say so - Full screen option - Easy, obvious access to reply, reply all, fwd, etc in the message viewer - You watch messages arrive when checking mail, instead of waiting for the polling to end, then waiting for all the messages to render in bulk like some other apps - Complete control of font sizes in all views - and the list goes on. THIS IS THE ONE.   Full Review   
 One of the best The most comprehensive email app I have used. Stop complaining and pay if you like it you cheap cu@&#s   Full Review

For one, there is no way to change the color of the appbar in the dark theme, as well as the color of the horizontal rule in the message list view.   Full Review
